title: Ornate display fonts on old New Year's card
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202055045im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Card%201_4212.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202055045im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Card%202_5259.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202055045im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Card%203_5618.jpg)

Can anyone identify these old fonts for me?  
Thank you.

 [‹ (x) multiple weights a straight-sided sans serif - H&FJ Knockout {BJ Harvey}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202055045/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40514 "Go to previous forum topic") [Condensed sans caps on plates affixed to French appartment buildings: " eau et gaz ..." ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202055045/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40476 "Go to next forum topic")
author: snozden

comments.content:
In [this thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202055045/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39209), some fonts are mentioned that are somewhat similar to #1.  
F
Spiral used to be called [Kismet](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202055045/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=kismet), when it was first designed by John F. Cumming in 1879.
